AMD is hiring a softwareengineering leader at our Bangalore ,  Karnatakalocation .  As the Manager ,  Software Development Engineering Linux Open Source Graphics ,  you will be responsible for buildingateam of software engineers to contribute to our open source GPU drivers for Linux .  As the successful candidate ,  you will have an established background in managing a software engineering team ,  preferably working on collaborative (upstream) open source projects of significant size .  You will report to Sr .  Manager ,  Software Development Engineering ,  Linux Open Source Graphics ,  located in Markham ,  Canada .  Yourteam will be responsible for : 

Open source GPU driver feature development based on Engineering and Marketing requirements;

Contributions to the open source software projects which comprise the Linux graphics driver stack (Linux kernel ,  Mesa ,  X . org ,  Wayland ,  LLVM ,  etc . );

GPU driver bring-up and qualification on new hardware platforms;

Investigation ,  analysis ,  and resolution of issues as reported by Customers and QA . Responsibilities

Hiring and onboarding new software engineers

Manage theteam including mentoring ,  goal setting ,  and conducting annual performance reviews

Work closely with your team to develop enhancements to the open source GPU drivers ,  tracking and fixing bugs ,  and testing drivers to be aligned with key deliverables

Provide technical guidance to junior engineers

Understand and present technical status updates to upper managers ,  peers ,  and engineering teams

Have technical insight to guide priorities and translate the asks into right actions

Build collaborative relationships with global engineering teams ,  esp .  Linux GPU driver teams in Markham and Shanghai . Minimum Requirements

10-15 yearsexperience as a software engineer ,  including experience as a manager in Linux and open source development

Undergraduate degree in technical discipline

Strong organizational and communication skills

Demonstrated track record of project delivery

Knowledge of software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle ,  including coding standards ,  code reviews ,  source control management ,  build processes ,  testing ,  and operations
